title: Reduce verbosity of linker error when output file is wrong type

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

body:
I made `~/test.rs` and forgot that I also had a directory named `~/test`. Because the linker could not output a binary at `~/test` it gave me this ugly error, which wrapped into about 10 extra lines on my terminal:

```
$ rustc test.rs
error: linking with `cc` failed: exit code: 1
  |
  = note: "cc" "-Wl,--as-needed" "-Wl,-z,noexecstack" "-m64" "-L" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib" "test.0.o" "-o" "test" "-Wl,--gc-sections" "-pie" "-nodefaultlibs" "-L" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib" "-Wl,-Bstatic" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libstd-f4594d3e53dcb114.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librand-1efbcfd8938372b6.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcollections-532a3dbf317eff86.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libstd_unicode-cfbd6648f7db2ee5.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libpanic_unwind-a0157c0ca919c364.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libunwind-488b4ab4bd53a138.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/liballoc-ca07b617414dd0fa.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/liballoc_jemalloc-492d8ea7fa3384ff.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/liblibc-88c194c15fdb6521.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcore-687e6a964d22cbb4.rlib" "/home/clar/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcompiler_builtins-987729be881d4d32.rlib" "-Wl,-Bdynamic" "-l" "dl" "-l" "rt" "-l" "pthread" "-l" "gcc_s" "-l" "pthread" "-l" "c" "-l" "m" "-l" "rt" "-l" "util"
  = note: /usr/sbin/ld: cannot open output file test: Is a directory
          collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```

It'd be nice if we could avoid showing the entire command here when it's just a simple user error.
